translation: (3) And what can make you know what is the Striking Calamity?
(4) It is the Day when people will be like moths, dispersed,[1975]
footnotes: [1975]- The people will be as such after having been expelled from their graves.

translation: (5) And the mountains will be like wool, fluffed up.[1976]
(6) Then as for one whose scales are heavy [with good deeds],
(7) He will be in a pleasant life.
(8) But as for one whose scales are light,
(9) His refuge[1977] will be an abyss.[1978]
footnotes: [1977]- Literally, "mother" (a man's original refuge) , which will envelop him as in an embrace. [1978]- i.e., the pit of Hellfire.

translation: (10) And what can make you know what that is?
(11) It is a Fire, intensely hot.
